Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

If you find yourself saying “I’m not a math person”, just add the word “yet” to the end of the sentence.

  1. Enter the given data into Desmos, then calculate the regression approximation to determine the curve of best fit.

    \(x_1\)

    \(y_1\)

    2

    56

    5

    116

    8

    155

    11

    205

    17

    230

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.12.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(y = -0.69x^2+ 24.83x + 8.07\).

The correct answer is \(y = -0.74x^2+ 34.32x + 7.44\).

For questions 5–9, use the following information.

The path of a toy rocket after launch is modeled by the following data set.

The height of the rocket, in feet, \(y\), corresponds to the number of seconds passed, \(x\).

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  1. What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the flight of the toy rocket?

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(y = -9.2x^2+ 46x + 3.51\).

  1. Approximately how high will the rocket be 2 seconds after launch?

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 8.12.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 58.71 feet.

  1. At what approximate times after launch will the rocket have a height of 20 feet?

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 0.39 seconds after launch and 4.61 seconds after launch.

  1. Approximately how long will it take the rocket to reach its maximum height?

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 8.12.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 2.50 seconds.

  1. Approximately how long will it take for the rocket to land on the ground?

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 5.08 seconds.

For question 10, Maria has found a curve of best fit using the equation below.

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  1. Maria is asked to predict the \(y\)-value on her curve when \(x = 10\). To do this, she graphs the function \(x = 10\) and analyzes the intersection point of the curve and the line.

What is the \(y\)-value Maria is asked to predict?

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 8.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 111.
